Mod Creation
• Directory Structure
• XML Assets
• Custom Maps
• Building a Mod
• Launching a Mod
If you are creating a Mod for Tiberium Wars, Red Alert 3, or Tiberium Twilight the name can be no more than 15 characters long. The length of mod names for Kane's Wrath doesn't matter.

The main folder for the source of your mod has to be Mods\[Mod Name].

Required Files:
If you are building a Mod for Tiberium Wars, Red Alert 3, or Tiberium Twilight you have to have a file called mod.xml in your Data folder.
For Kane's Wrath your main file for static data would be called Static.xml. For global data you have to use AdditionalMaps\MapMetaData_Global.xml and AdditionalMaps\MapMetaData_GlobalOverrides.xml. These are also the files that are referenced by the default batch files supplied with WrathEd. These names are hard coded and renaming will cause your Mod not to work.

String Table:
Tiberium Wars, Red Alert 3, and Tiberium Twilight support a file called mod.str to store strings. This is a simple text file and only needed if you add or modify text in the game.
An example of an entry in the mod.str file: 
NAME:Orca
"Orca Fighter"
END
Kane's Wrath doesn't directly support a mod.str file. However, the WrathEd Mod Launcher supports either mod.csf or data\mod.str and combines them with the string table of Kane's Wrath.
